channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for CA

item.title: Report X-2023081090
item.description:
Report X-2023081090

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-14T03:11:45+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-04
  • City: LOS ANGELES
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: When package was being unloaded from the trailer, it was wet so package was sent to QA for inspection by management. When inspected, two bottles inside package was found with loose caps causing leakage. DescribePack: Loose cap on plastic bottle was the cause of the leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a plastic tote by management to contain the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023081087
item.description:
Report X-2023081087

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-03
  • City: SAN LEANDRO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Carton removed from unload wet placed in a hazardous material bag. DescribePack: Loose Cap DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Cap was tighten, bottle wiped with water to removed staines on bottles. Then placed in a hazardous material bag inside a yellow salvage drum along with all material used.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 5 gallon can of purple degreaser (un3266) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 1 gallon of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report X-2023080866
item.description:
Report X-2023080866

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-10
  • City: SACRAMENTO
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: UNDECLARED HAZMAT PACKAGE CAME FROM LOADSIDE WET AND TORN. NO MARKINGS USED INDICATING SHIPPING STATUS OF GOODS. DAMAGED DURING OVERHEAD SORTATION. DescribePack: BOTH BOTTLES LEAKED FROM LOOSE CAPS AND BROKEN SEALS. SIX OUNCES OF MATERIALS LOSS. SPILL ISOLATED TO PACKAGING. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: PACKAGE PLACED IN HAZMAT BAG LINED DRUM.

item.title: Report X-2023080848
item.description:
Report X-2023080848

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The shipment exterior packaging was wet on the top side and the box was removed from the sort stream and placed into a plastic lined container. DescribePack: One of the bottles of the shipment had a loose unsealed cap ; seepage had collected near the join to the rest of the body. DurationRel: 6 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was soaked up with neutral absorbent material. The rest of the items in the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection and processing.

item.title: Report X-2023080835
item.description:
Report X-2023080835

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-09
  • City: SANTA FE SPRINGS
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Managers called in for a spill. Upon arriving I noticed it was a hazmat and I equipped the proper PPE. I used absorbent to mitigate the spill, placed the package in a hazardous material bag and tote and brought to QA for processing. DescribePack: Bottle cap failed to seal, causing leakage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: I placed absorbent mats to mitigate the leakage.

item.title: Report X-2023080822
item.description:
Report X-2023080822

Identified by scraper @ 2023-09-11T03:12:58+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: OCEANSIDE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment was discovered to have discoloration on two sites on the box exterior and it was removed from the sort stream and put into a plastic lined container. DescribePack: Three of the bottles in the shipment had loose caps with moisture apparent around closure join to their bodies. DurationRel: 3 and MitigateEffect: Excess liquid was sopped up with neutral absorbent materials. The rest of the shipment was placed into a plastic lined container for inspection.

item.title: Report X-2023080821
item.description:
Report X-2023080821

  • Incident Date: 2023-08-08
  • City: ROSEVILLE
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was found at the QA square leaking. Package was immediately bagged and placed in a haz tote. DescribePack: The lids of both bottles are loose, causing them to leak out. There is also some minor denting in the body of the bottles. DurationRel: 23 and MitigateEffect: On discovery, package was immediately bagged and placed in a haz tote.
